DataElement.preferredName: Exploratory Cohort Study Enrollment Prior Medical History Malignancy Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response for questions to determine eligibility for clinical trial participation in an exploratory cohort study with previous history of malignancy as outlined in the protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Exploratory Research Cohort Study Enrollment Prior Personal Medical History Malignant Neoplasm Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any action or process to perform research on a hypothetical or theoretical idea in order to determine whether the phenomena is new (which may lead to additional studies) or can be explained by an existing and well-substantiated theory._A research study that compares a particular outcome (such as lung cancer) in groups of individuals who are alike in many ways but differ by a certain characteristic (for example, female nurses who smoke compared with those who do not smoke)._The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled._Earlier in time or order._A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies._A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any action or process to perform research on a hypothetical or theoretical idea in order to determine whether the phenomena is new (which may lead to additional studies) or can be explained by an existing and well-substantiated theory.:A research study that compares a particular outcome (such as lung cancer) in groups of individuals who are alike in many ways but differ by a certain characteristic (for example, female nurses who smoke compared with those who do not smoke).:The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled.

Concepts.definition: Any action or process to perform research on a hypothetical or theoretical idea in order to determine whether the phenomena is new (which may lead to additional studies) or can be explained by an existing and well-substantiated theory.

A research study that compares a particular outcome (such as lung cancer) in groups of individuals who are alike in many ways but differ by a certain characteristic (for example, female nurses who smoke compared with those who do not smoke).
The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled.

Property.preferredName: Prior Personal Medical History Malignant Neoplasm Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.:A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: If patient enrolled to the ph
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient enrolled to the phase 2 or non-thoracic, non-BRD4 exploratory cohort has a  history of prior malignancy they meet one or more of the following criteria: participants with non-melanoma skin cancers that have been curatively treated; participants with adequately treated carcinomas in situ of any type; or participants who were diagnosed and curatively treated at least 3 years prior to the date of study entry and who are considered by the treating investigator to be at low risk for recurrence?
